title: Exponential and Logarithmic - End Behavior - Part B

content.description: The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>1.02</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>ln</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4073@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, respectively.
content.question:
Part B

(i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

(ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> for input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> that are less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math> and sufficiently close to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math>. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

frqParts.text:
Part B

(i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

(ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> for input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> that are less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math> and sufficiently close to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math>. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
